Naomi is tearing up a little. "Ever since she brought me to her home, she hasn't given me any freedom. Unless it's with her, I can't go out and do stuff anymore. And, anytime I want to do something, she quickly dismisses it. Instead, we have to do what she wants."

"Nope!" Naomi responds. "I think it's kinda cute that you like feet. It's different, ya know?"

The quiet Naomi is quickly becoming quite a bubbly talker, and you rather like this version better. "Yeah, but I get so nervous that people will think I'm weird if I tell them," you admit.

With a smile on your face and a grateful nod, you walk back into the van and discuss the details with Naomi. Worry is written all over Chelsea's face, but you're too busy to notice.

A few hours later....

You casually pull into Chelsea's driveway in your parent's car. You come to the arcade frequently enough to notice the clerk at the prize desk is new. In fact, you cannot recall seeing her at school either, despite looking to be about the same age as you. About your height, the new girl has medium length brown-to-blonde ombre hair flowing magnificently down her neck. Her thick lashes convey boredom, along with the fact she leaning against the desk in such a way. New people in this town are rare, and this gives you a chance to make a fresh start with a new face.

"Slow day for you?" you greet as you approach the girl.

She gives you a half smile. "Kinda. Not really anything to do right now."

"Are you new? I haven't ever seen you before in here," you ask.

The girl stands up, revealing a nametag that reads "Maisie." "Yep, moved into town two weeks ago. Don't really know anyone here, so basically I work and then lock myself in my apartment all day."

"I'm (your name), nice to meet you!" you introduce yourself.

"Maisie," as she shakes your hand. "You're the first guy that's really taken the right interest with me. A bunch of dads come up and flirt with me. Kinda creeps me out, to be honest."

"Well, I'm not old, and I hope I'm not creepy," you joke lamely. It does seem to warm Maisie up to you though.

"So (your name), what's there to do in this town?" she asks politely. "Anything fun go on this time of year?"

For about 10 minutes, you two chat it up. If this had been anyone else in town, you'd be twice as nervous. However, Maisie seems very approachable, even with her gorgeous blue eyes staring attentively at you. If things continue to go well, did you have the balls to ask her out on a date.

You also notice that Maisie is wearing a pair of grey keds on her shoes, seemingly without socks. She plays with her right shoe while talking to you, although never getting close to slipping them off.

"So what's your favorite game here?" you ask her.

Maisie shakes her head. "Honestly, I'm not really into these kinda games. I think it's dumb, spending all your money on stuff like this." Being someone who likes these "dumb games," you feel like you've taken a step back with her. Possible sensing this, Maisie adds, "well I guess I like the skill games a little bit. Some of the prizes are pretty cool, but I can't win them for myself."

The wall behind is lined with oversize plush toys, inflatable hammers, puppets, and other cool stuff up for grabs. "What's one that you like?" you want to know.

"That HUGE Angry Birds head!" she delightfully exclaims. "I'm addicted to the game, and it would be so cool to add that to my bedroom."

You look up at the tag on the prize. 10,000 tickets for the head.

"Wow, that's a lot of tickets," you point out. "Maybe it'd be cheaper to just buy it from a store."

"I know right?!" Maisie agrees. "I've looked for it online, but I can't find it anywhere. My manager says it's not up for retail, so people will play for it."

A wonderful idea crosses your mind. "What if I won it for you?"

A slight blush comes over the attractive young woman's face. "Oh (your name), you're seriously too sweet, but I couldn't ask that from you. One, we just met. Two, that's a hell of a lot of tickets."

But you're on a confidence high. "Not to toot my own whistle, but I'm pretty good at all these games. I've been coming here since I was little, so I think I know which ones will pay out best."

Maisie realizes you're being completely serious. "If you're trying to impress me, please stop. It's too much to ask for in return, and I don't like owing people."

Dangerous territory is being crossed, but you push on anyways. "Fine, then if I win the toy, you have to do something for me."

"Oh really?" Maisie laughs. "And what would that be?"

You smile. "If I win that Angry Bird...."

There is only one way you're going to win this bet, and it's putting all your money on a spinning wheel game. The chances were slim, but the payouts were huge when you did win.

After spending all your cash on tokens, you approach the game, which is quite simple really. The large wheel closely resembles what you see on Wheel-of-Fortune, with different ticket amounts on sections of the wheel. The higher the prize, the smaller the wedged section is. There were 4 areas that coughed up 1,000 tickets, but they were barely big enough for the token to land on. To make it more difficult, token shooter spins out the tokens on their side, as opposed to flat. Even if one did hit the section, the token usually rolled around on the wheel, sometimes falling off completely and awarding no prize.

Here we go," you say to yourself.

You insert your first coin in, then take aim. While it is tempting to aim first for the 1,000 ticket sections, you decide to start slowly, aiming for a 20 ticket section. You hit your mark and are rewarded with tickets. Firing your second coin, you're off the mark and don't get any tickets....

Fast forward awhile later......

You feel like you've been at this forever, but an end is in sight. You're sitting at 9.000 tickets, assuming you've kept good count so far. A few younger kids have been watching you play, awed by how you're doing. They don't even seem to care you're taking up one of the 3 wheel stations in the whole arcade.

But now, you have a choice to make. You're down to only 5 tokens, and you still need 1,000 tickets to hit your goal.

"I can either go for the 200 and 500 prizes..." you take a look across the wheel, "or I can aim all 5 at the 1,000 prize."

Math has never been your strong suit, but you feel your best chance is to go with the latter option. You've already scored one 1,000 ticket prize today, though it took you quite a few attempts to hit it; definitely more than 5.

Focusing on the one of the sections, you take your time in aiming. The kids are surprisingly quiet and patient, though eagerness is written all over their faces. You take the shot....and miss. An unfavorable roll didn't even score you any tickets.

Shot two.....miss the 1,000, but hit a 50. That's not going to help much though.

Shot three......miss and hit a 10.

Shot four.........HIT HIT HIT!!!

Though the token rolls a little, it circles right back and lands nearly square on the 1,000 ticket section. The kids around you applaud almost as excited as you are.

"What's going on?"

You turn around, and Maisie is walking towards you. She sees all the tickets you have and gasps.

"Oh my...you didn't actually do it, did you?"

"Yep, 10,000 tickets," you exclaim proudly.

Maisie looks unsure of how to react. The kids congratulate you, then scatter to the wind. You collect all your tickets and head off to the counter to buy the Angry Birds toy, Maisie following close behind. Indeed, she counts up all the tickets and you do have 10,000 and a little extra.

"I can't believe it," she whispers, then looks around. "It'd look bad if you just gave it to me right off the bat. Can you wait until after I'm off?"

You take the stuffed toy. "Sure! Meet in the parking lot?"

She shakes her head. "Yeah, but maybe we'll do this....thing somewhere else."

Her face looks embarrassed, possibly ashamed. On the other hand, you feel happy and proud, walking out the door with a big grin on your face.

"It's a Moogle silly!" Callie laughs. "Haven't you ever played Final Fantasy?!"

The costume is bulky, with a huge red pom-pom on top of the cute fictional creature's head.

"You should wear this!" Callie insists. "That way, you can join me and my friends the rest of the day."

You are starting to have second thoughts. Even though Callie is extremely attractive, wearing that funny-looking suit all day doesn't sound like too much fun.

Possibly sensing this, Callie gives you a childish pouty face. "Please, it'd mean SO much to me if you did."

"Alright," you give in. "I'll wear it, but I'll definitely need a few breaks. I might get cooked in that thing!"

"Thank you, thank you!" she jumps up and down, then precedes to bear hug you and peck you on your blushing cheek.

You quickly put on the costume, albeit with some difficulty. You are certainly tall enough, but not wide enough, to fit in the Moogle costume. Callie, however, thinks you look cute.

"It's perfect!" she declares. "You make the perfect little Moogle (your name). Callie has her boots back on and staff in hand. "Let's go join my friends back out on the floor. They've probably been wondering where I've been."

She wraps her arm around yours and you walk back out to the convention center together. Navigating through the crowd is difficult. The eye slits make it hard to see, and costume legs are clumsy at best. Without Callie there to guide you, there would be no way you can get through the crowd.

Soon, Callie waves her free arm at a group of three people: 2 girls and 1 guy.

"Hey guys! I found someone to wear the Moogle costume, look!" Callie announces.

Callie's friends were also decked out in Final Fantasy costumes; The guy in a passable Squall Leonhart costume, a tall girl dressed as Lightning Farron for FF13, and the other shorter girl as a character you didn't recognize.

"What poor soul did you find to wear that shitty costume?!" the guy asks smugly.

"Be nice Roger!" Callie shot back, her forcefulness a bit surprising to you. "Everyone, this is (your name)."

"Nice to meet you, I'm Courtney," the girl dressed as Lightning attempts to shake your hand.

"Nice to meet you too," your reply muffled by the costume's lack of mouth.

"And this rude fellow over here is Roger," Callie introduces. "He can talk crap about your costume all he likes, but his isn't any better/"

Roger's right brow shot up. "My costumes is just fine Callie. At least I don't look like a hippo." He looks at you. "No offense man, I just don't get why you'd agree to wear that."

You notice Callie blushing slightly, most likely remembering everything that'd gone down a moment ago. The other girl approaches you next, a wicked smirk on her face. You are ironically glad your face is concealed in costume head, as your eyes would obviously be looking down this girl's ample cleavage.

"Hi, I'm Jocelyn," she says. "How do you like MY costume?!"

In truth, you still can't figure out who she is. You haven't played every single Final Fantasy game, and Jocelyn could be a character you don't know. Or perhaps she senses you eyes are lurking further down. Her costume is definitely meant to be sexy. Her top barely manages to conceal her busty midriff, her white leggings see-through, and high heeled boots all made her stick out.

"It's awesome!" you exclaim, hoping she will leave it at that.

"See guys?! This guy knows a costume when he sees it!" Jocelyn brags proudly. "Terra is so much cooler than people realize."

"Oh! Terra from FF6!" you realize privately. "Yeah, I've never played that game before."

Of course, it's best Jocelyn isn't aware that you aren't really familiar with her character. Instead, your eyes float over to Courtney. She too is very pretty, with her costume down pretty well. Her dyed-pink hair is even styled the same way as Lightning's. Courtney has the long, thin face and piercing eyes that her character possesses in the game. Her legs were miles long, but smooth and very sexy. A pair of combat boots were on her feet.

As much as you like Callie and her pretty little feet, you also want to have a bit of fun with these two girls as well.

14411112221.content:
After being acquainted with Callie's friends, you spend the rest of the day with them. The anime convention actually proves to be loads more fun than you anticipate, even in a clumsy, sweaty Moogle costume. Everyone there is fun and friendly, plus you think most of the costumes are awesome. You find yourself spending a particularly large amount of time with Courtney, one of Callie's best friends. Quickly, you learn more and more about her.

Courtney isn't a huge Final Fantasy fan, but thinks Lightning is badass. She's a bit timid compared to her character, also friendly to you and interested in getting to know you the most of any of Callie's friends. You too are getting quite interested in Courtney, but perhaps not in the same way. Admiring her with any chance you get, you did have to admit she is giving Callie a run for her money. Courtney is tall, skinny, pale, but very pretty. Her gorgeous eyes are especially good features.

As the convention starts to wind down, you eventually find yourself with Courtney, away from the others. You both sit in a hallway with a few other cosplayers, mostly everyone tired and sitting down. Having enough of the Moogle costume, you remove the headpiece.

"Man, my face feels sweaty," you whine.

Courtney regards you and then laughs. "Your face looks like a big tomato," she comments. "But still, it's an improvement over the Moogle face."

"Is that a compliment, or a diss on Callie's costumes?" you wonder.

"Well, I'm sure you're a bit sweaty from your costume as well," you say.

Courtney groans. "Oh my feet are killing me!" she exclaims. "I'd take my boots of, but..."

She curiously cut herself off. "What? Why won't you take them off?" you ask, sensing a possible chance at Courtney's feet.

A blush comes over the tall beauty's face. "It's kinda embarrassing......but my feet get really stinky easily." She giggles nervously. "Almost anytime I take my shoes off in public, someone says something mean or makes a face."

It's obvious Courtney is very sensitive about this, but you want to encourage her. "It's ok Courtney, I won't say anything like that."

The pink-haired cosplayer smiles. "Thanks (your name), but it's everyone else here I'm worried about." Her eyes dart up and down the hall. "I'm afraid someone will catch a whiff....it's embarrassing."

Once more, you try to convince Courtney otherwise. "Don't worry about what they think. In fact, I can give you a foot rub if you're willing to take your boots off."

Courtney gives you an astonished look. "You'd give me a foot rub? Even after I admit my feet probably smell funky?!"

"Yeah, of course," you say. "Take it as a thanks for letting me have fun with you guys today."

That seems to do the trick. "Ok, but don't say I didn't warn you." Courtney slowly unzips both boots, revealing dirty-looking socks. Not only did they look blackened, but there are several large holes and rips. "Cosplay at it's worse," Courtney jokes.

Placing her boots aside, Courtney pulls the socks of her large feet and stretches her long legs out. Courtney's feet, pale like the rest of her, are narrow and indeed very damp in sweat. She wipes off a bit of fuzz cramped between her long, unpainted toes.

"What size do you wear?" I ask.

"Women's size 11," Courtney chuckles. "Big feet run in my dad's side of the family. It took me forever to find the right looking boots in this size for my costume."

As Courtney predicted, a strong, musky smell hits your nostrils.
14411112221.title: Courtney (Lightning from FF13)

choices: "We should get back to the others," you insist.
144111122212.content:
A few seconds later....

"What the fuck is that smell?!"

You turn around and see a Dragonball Z cosplayer pinching his nose.

"Oh god, it smells like sulfur and rotten eggs!" the drama queen announces loudly to the whole room. He looks around for the source, until he sees Courtney. "Is it you bigfoot?! Why the fuck would you take your boots off if they smell like death?!"

Several people laugh, others pick up their stuff and move away. Courtney's face somehow turns another shade paler, her eyes widen in fear and embarrassment.

Unfortunately, the guy isn't done. "What wrong? Petrified by your own foul stench?! Get the hell out of here!"

"Leave her alone!" you come to Courtney's rescue. "Her feet are tired, and she has the right to take her shoes off if she wants to. Have a problem? Then find another spot to relax!"

"No (your name), it's fine," Courtney got up, grabbing her boots. "I know somewhere to go...."

And without another word, Courtney heads off towards the exit. Triumphant, the cosplayer sits back down on the floor and relaxes. Everything returns to normal.

"That was rude," you thought, but didn't dare say out loud. You head off in Courtney's direction, having a bad feeling.

You find Courtney outside the convention center, sitting on a bench alone. Her eyes are glued to the ground, the pretty cosplayer obviously upset.

"May I sit with you?" you ask politely.

Courtney looks up and half-heartedly smiles at you. "Sure, if you can stand the smell."

You take a seat. "That guy was a jerk, don't worry about it. I didn't think your feet smelled bad really."

"How can you say that?" Courtney questions in an upset tone.

A blush comes over your face. Do you tell Courtney the truth, even though you only met her today? How will she react?

"Can I tell you secret?" you ask. "Something that no one really knows about me?"

"Of course," Courtney grows curious. "My lips are sealed."

You chuckle nervously. "Well, I kinda have this strange turn-on...."

"I think everyone does," Courtney assures you. "But go on."

"It's....feet," you blurt out. "I think feet are really pretty, and think your's are too."

A moment of silence follows, before Courtney speaks again. "You really think my feet are pretty? Why?"

"You don't think it's weird?" you say.

"Like I said, everyone's got their thing," the tall cosplayer repeats. "No, I don't think it's weird. I just don't get why you'd find my pretty."

You look down at her feet, which are still bare. "I like the size, to start. They're really nice for big feet." You look around for other people, which there aren't. "And honestly, the smell doesn't really bother me. It kinda does the opposite."

Courtney laughs and laughs, and then laughs some more. Soon, the poor girl is holding on to her sides, hoping to contain herself.

"What's so funny?" you ask. Suddenly, you feel a bit judged.

"It's just, that's the first time anyone's ever said anything so nice about my feet!" Courtney explains. "It's just funny, that's all" She manages to get a grip. "I'm not laughing AT you (your name). That's the nicest thing a guy has ever said to me."

Suddenly, Courtney kisses you the cheek. "Thank you!"

"Oh boy, now I got both Callie and Courtney to like me," you thought nervously. Still, that kiss felt pretty awesome.

Courtney takes her own look around. "So the coast is clear....do you maybe want to smell my feet?"
